org.dejave.attica.engine.operators
Class MergeJoin

java.lang.Object
  org.dejave.attica.engine.operators.Operator
      org.dejave.attica.engine.operators.BinaryOperator
          org.dejave.attica.engine.operators.PhysicalJoin
              org.dejave.attica.engine.operators.NestedLoopsJoin
                  org.dejave.attica.engine.operators.MergeJoin

public class MergeJoin
extends NestedLoopsJoin

MergeJoin: Implements a merge join. The assumptions are that the input is already sorted on the join attributes and the join being evaluated is an equi-join.

Author:
sviglas

Constructor Detail

MergeJoin

public MergeJoin(Operator left,
                 Operator right,
                 StorageManager sm,
                 int leftSlot,
                 int rightSlot,
                 Predicate predicate)
          throws EngineException
Constructs a new mergejoin operator.

Parameters:
left - the left input operator.
right - the right input operator.
sm - the storage manager.
leftSlot - pointer to the left sort attribute.
rightSlot - pointer to the right sort attribute.
predicate - the predicate evaluated by this join operator.
Throws:
EngineException - thrown whenever the operator cannot be properly constructed.

innerProcessTuple

protected java.util.List<Tuple> innerProcessTuple(Tuple tuple,
                                                  int inOp)
                                           throws EngineException
Inner tuple processing. Returns an empty list but if all goes well it should never be called. It's only there for safety in case things really go badly wrong and I've messed things up in the rewrite.

Overrides:
innerProcessTuple in class NestedLoopsJoin
Parameters:
tuple - the tuple to be processed.
inOp - the index of the input operator the tuple to be processed belongs to.
Returns:
the resulting tuples.
Throws:
EngineException - thrown whenever there is something wrong with processing the tuple.
